name: oj-rgbu-jraf-apps-panel-bar
description: The Apps Panel Bar displays a toolbar at the bottom of the page with four content areas: main actions, navigation actions, additional actions and a custom content region.

buttonSize.description: An optional parameter to change the size of the buttons. Valid values are: small, large, and xl. No value results in the default medium size.

mainActionChroming.description: A chroming value for the main action buttons. Valid values are solid, borderless, and outlined. (full and half are deprecated)

mainActionButtons.description: An array of buttons to display in the main actions section. Buttons are rendered right to left.

navigationChroming.description: A chroming value for the navigation buttons. Valid values are solid, borderless and outlined. (full and half are deprecated)

navigationIconOnly.description: A boolean value for whether navigation buttons should render only icons. Default false.

nextCallback.description: The navigation callback to be executed when the next button is pressed. Providing this will cause the button to be rendered.

nextDisabled.description: A boolean for whether the next button is disabled. This parameter supports observables. Default false.

nextShortcut.description: A character to use as part of a keyboard shortcut for the next button. The full shortcut is determined by the browser.

prevCallback.description: The navigation callback to be executed when the previous button is pressed. Providing this will cause the button to be rendered.

prevDisabled.description: A boolean for whether the previous button is disabled. This parameter supports observables. Default false.

prevShortcut.description: A character to use as part of a keyboard shortcut for the previous button. The full shortcut is determined by the browser.

extraActionChroming.description: A chroming value for the extra action buttons. Valid values are solid, borderless, and outlined. (full and half are deprecated)

extraActionButtons.description: An array of buttons to display in the extra actions section. Buttons are rendered right to left.

layout.description: Layout type.  Supported types include 'float' (default) and 'inline'.  Use inline layout to control the position of the apps panel bar component within your content.

customContent.description: Displays user-defined content alongside the buttons
